snippet: A flotilla of 1,000 boats in celebration of Queen Elizabeth II’s diamond jubilee set off down the Thames on Sunday in an extravagant royal pageant of a kind last seen 350 years ago.
abstract: More than 1 million people line the banks of the Thames River in London to acclaim Queen Elizabeth II as she marks 60 years on the throne with a royal river pageant of a kind last seen 350 years ago; this is only the second diamond jubilee to be celebrated in British history, with the first being that of Queen Victoria in 1897.
lead_paragraph: A flotilla of 1,000 boats in celebration of Queen Elizabeth II’s diamond jubilee set off down the Thames on Sunday in an extravagant royal pageant of a kind last seen 350 years ago.

headline.seo: Queen Elizabeth Jubilee Celebration Under Way

keywords.value: Elizabeth II, Queen of Great Britain
keywords.name: persons
